feed.title: GitHub CSS Daily Trending

entry.title: Charca/astro-view-transitions
entry.summary:
Demo of Astro MPA using the View Transitions API

Smooth Page Transitions with Astro & the Shared Element Transition API

To try out this project, make sure to enable the experimental View Transitions API flag in Google Chrome. Based on the original Codrops experiment by [Mary Lou]https://twitter.com/crnacura).

ğŸ§ Commands

All commands are run from the root of the project, from a terminal:

Command Action
npm install Installs dependencies
npm run dev Starts local dev server at localhost:3000
npm run build Build your production site to ./dist/
npm run preview Preview your build locally, before deploying
npm run astro ... Run CLI commands like astro add, astro preview
npm run astro --help Get help using the Astro CLI

ğŸ‘€ Want to learn more?

Feel free to check our documentation or jump into our Discord server.

entry.title: iamverysimp1e/dots
entry.summary:
My customization + configuration with Linux ğŸ§

âœ¨Tue Nhan's dot filesâœ¨

Contents:

ğŸ‘» Don't blindly use my setup. Use at your own risk!!!

  • Neovim Setups
  • Windows Manger:
    • HyprLand ğŸ™
    • GNOME ğŸ™
    • Microsoft Windows
  • Oh My Posh
  • zsh
  • Addition Apps and Terminal Tools

Hyprland ğŸ™:

Setup ğŸ”§:

To install my dots just R.T.F.M

1. Install Required dependencies:

âš ï¸ This setup instructions only provided for Arch Linux (and other Arch-based distributions)

  • First of all, Install the newest Hyprland using this guide depend on your Distro:

    yay -S hyprland-git

  • Install Rofi, Dunst, Waybar and Alacritty(optional):

    yay -S rofi dunst waybar-hyprland-git alacritty
2. Install my dots:

Clone the repos

git clone https://github.com/iamverysimp1e/dots
cd dots/.config

Copy configs file + Wallpaper

cp -r waybar alacritty hypr rofi dunst ~/.config
# Wallpaper
cp -r Wallpaper ~/Pictures

Install a few font

Necessary Font:

  • FiraCode Nerd Font
  • JetBrains Mono Nerd Font

Optional Font:

  • NotoColorEmoji
  • Codicon

Once you download them and unpack them, place them into ~/.fonts or ~/.local/share/fonts.

Then run this command for your system to detect the newly installed fonts.

fc-cache -fv

Congratulations! You had installed this beautiful rice on your machineğŸš Log out your current desktop session and login to Hyprland:)

Credits

Thanks to R/unixporn community & Hyprland Development Discord servier

GNOME ğŸ™:

Gnome configs

  • GTK Themes: Based on AestheticStuff by Rxyhn

  • GTK Icons:Papirus icons

  • Mutter Rounded (Optional): Windows manager for GNOME (for blur windows effect)

  • Gnome Shell Extensions:

    • Aylur's Widget: Beautiful Plugins with customizable bar

    • Blur My Shell: Blur the gnome shell

    • User Themes: Load shell themes from user directories

    • Color Picker: The simple color picker for gnome shell

    • Compiz alike magic lamp effect: Magic lamp effect alike the macOS minimize effect

    • Extension List: A Simple Gnome shell extension manager in the top panel

    • Just Perfection: SImple tweak tools to customize the gnome shell and disable some UI Features

    • Open Weather: A simple weather app for gnome shell

    • Sound Input & Output Device Chooser:Shows a list of sound output and input devices (similar to gnome sound settings) in the status menu below the volume slider.

    • Unite: Remove the title bars of the windows for the minimalist in windows

    • Vitals: A simple system monitor on the top bar

    • gtk title bar:remove title bar for non-gtk apps with minimal inference

    • Rounded Window Corners: Rounded corners for all windows

    • Bar (based on smooth by Aylur Themes ):

      DISCLAIMER âš ï¸: This bar color mod is still in progress and some color sections may not appear correctly if you want to contribute really grateful about that !

      • Install all of the Extensions above then copy .themes to ~/.themes
      • Open Gnome tweaks -> Appearance -> Shell -> Choose Smooth

  • Gnome tweaks (for apply themes and icons ) installation:

    sudo apt update && sudo apt upgrade
sudo apt install gnome-tweaks

Neovim Setups :

Optional Package and apps
  • Setups:
â”œâ”€â”€ init.lua
â”œâ”€â”€ lua
â”‚  â””â”€â”€ user
â”‚     â”œâ”€â”€ alpha.lua
â”‚     â”œâ”€â”€ autocommands.lua
â”‚     â”œâ”€â”€ autopairs.lua
â”‚     â”œâ”€â”€ bufferline.lua
â”‚     â”œâ”€â”€ cmp.lua
â”‚     â”œâ”€â”€ colorizer.lua
â”‚     â”œâ”€â”€ colorscheme.lua
â”‚     â”œâ”€â”€ comment.lua
â”‚     â”œâ”€â”€ gitsigns.lua
â”‚     â”œâ”€â”€ impatient.lua
â”‚     â”œâ”€â”€ indentline.lua
â”‚     â”œâ”€â”€ keymaps.lua
â”‚     â”œâ”€â”€ lsp
â”‚     â”‚  â”œâ”€â”€ configs.lua
â”‚     â”‚  â”œâ”€â”€ handlers.lua
â”‚     â”‚  â”œâ”€â”€ init.lua
â”‚     â”‚  â”œâ”€â”€ null-ls.lua
â”‚     â”‚  â””â”€â”€ settings
â”‚     â”‚     â”œâ”€â”€ jsonls.lua
â”‚     â”‚     â”œâ”€â”€ pyright.lua
â”‚     â”‚     â””â”€â”€ sumneko_lua.lua
â”‚     â”œâ”€â”€ lualine.lua
â”‚     â”œâ”€â”€ nvim-transparent.lua
â”‚     â”œâ”€â”€ nvim-tree.lua
â”‚     â”œâ”€â”€ options.lua
â”‚     â”œâ”€â”€ plugins.lua
â”‚     â”œâ”€â”€ project.lua
â”‚     â”œâ”€â”€ syntax.lua
â”‚     â”œâ”€â”€ telescope.lua
â”‚     â”œâ”€â”€ toggleterm.lua
â”‚     â”œâ”€â”€ treesitter.lua
â”‚     â””â”€â”€ whichkey.lua
â””â”€â”€ plugin
   â””â”€â”€ packer_compiled.lua
  • Installations:
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:neovim-ppa/unstable
sudo apt update && sudo apt upgrade
sudo apt install neovim

  • Get healthy:

    • Open nvim and enter the following:
    :checkhealth
    • You probably notice you don't have support for copy and paste also that python and node haven't been setup
      • On Ubuntu:
      sudo apt install xsel
      • On Arch:
      sudo pacman -S xsel
    • Next we need to install python support (Node is optional)
      • Neovim python support:
      pip install pynvim
# or
pip3 install pynvim
      • Neovim Node support
      npm i -g neovim

  • Other optional package for formatting & finding text:):

    • Prettier
    npm install -g prettier
    • Black (Python formatter)
    pip install black
    • Ripgrep
    paru -S ripgrep

  • On Fedora you have to install c++ and lstdc++ :

sudo dnf install g++
#and
sudo yum install glibc-static libstdc++-static -y;
  • On windows you have to install
    • gcc: 
      sccop install gcc
    • Zig 
      scoop install zig

Windows SETUPS:

Windows configs
  • Terminal : Windows Terminal
  • Scoop : A package manager for windows
  • Prompt: Oh my posh
  • Tutorial is inspired by this video
  • Optional Package:
    • Terminal icons - Icons for terminal :
    Install-Module -Name Terminal-Icons -Repository PSGallery -Force
    • Z - Directory jump:
    Install-Module -Name z -Force
    • PsFzf - Fuzzy finder:
    Install-Module -Name PSFzf -Force
    • PSReadLine - Use for completions:
    Install-Module -Name PSReadLine -AllowPrerelease -Scope CurrentUser -Force -SkipPublisherCheck
  • âš ï¸ In case you don't have PowerShell profile yet: 
    New-Item -Path $PROFILE -type File -force

Oh my Posh :

  • I use Oh my Posh for my prompt themes Check my Awsome Prompt themes for more details !!

Zsh :

  • I use oh-my-zsh as zsh framework and zap as my plugin manager, extensions that i use:
    • zsh-autosuggestion
    • zsh-syntax-highlight

Apps & Other Terminal Tools :

  • Alacritty: Fast, Open GL Terminal Emulator
  • FlatPak: Package manager for Linux
    • Kooha: Elegantly screen recorder
  • Howdy: Windows Hello Style authentication for Linux
  • Fusuma: Multitouch gesture recognizer. This makes your linux able to recognize swipes or pinches
    • How to make it runs when turn on your machine:
      • Go to start up application
      • Then click to add:
        • Name section: fusuma
        • Command section: fusuma

Terminal Tools

  • Pipe.sh: Animated pipes terminal screeen saver
  • Cmatrix Installations:
sudo apt update && sudo apt upgrade
sudo apt install cmatrix
